message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS

The paper deals with index codes for the Gaussian broadcast channel, which is a topic in information theory and communication systems. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communication and Networking) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of linear codes and integer rings, which are topics in algebra and number theory, respectively. Therefore, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the use of side information gain as a code design metric, which is a topic in signal processing and machine learning. Therefore, cs.SI (Signal Processing) is another possible sub-category.
